title: Sony Honda Mobility Inc’s Afeela EV Will Challenge Tesla

title: Honeywell Settles FCPA Violations for $42M Over International Bribery Schemes

Honeywell has also entered a deferred prosecution agreement with the U.S. Department of Justice and the Brazilian government, agreeing to further penalties and accountability reforms.

Honeywell UOP will pay a criminal penalty of approximately $79 million and $81 million in disgorgement and prejudgment interest.

title: Honeywell Agrees to Pay $160 Million Over Bribery Schemes in Brazil, Algeria
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has agreed to pay over $160 million to settle US claims regarding bribery schemes in Brazil and Algeria. title: Honeywell to pay about $200 mln to settle U.S., Brazilian bribery charges

summary: Honeywell International Inc. has introduced its Carbon and Energy Management system. This system is designed to not only measure emissions but also provide methods for decarbonizing building operations. The launch aims to contribute to more sustainable buildings.

title: Honeywell to tackle SAF challenges
summary: Honeywell is addressing challenges in sustainable aviation fuels (SAF) production, particularly feedstock shortages, through its Universal Oil Products (UOP) Ecofining process. This technology converts various inedible feedstocks into renewable jet fuel, with Malaysia's abundance of biomass offering potential solutions. Honeywell UOP has also been pivotal in commercializing SAF production and obtaining ASTM certifications.

title: CVR Energy subsidiary selects Honeywell for a lower-carbon hydrogen study at Coffeyville site
summary: CVR Energy's subsidiary, Coffeyville Resources & Marketing, LLC, has tapped Honeywell for a feasibility study focusing on lower-carbon hydrogen production at its Coffeyville, Kansas site. The study will assess carbon capture and hydrogen purification technologies to reduce emissions, building on the site's existing evaluation of Honeywell UOP Ecofining technology for renewable diesel production. This collaboration aims to further decarbonize operations and reduce the carbon intensity of their products.

title: DENSO, Honeywell Co-Develop E-Motor for Lilium's All-Electric Jet
summary: DENSO and Honeywell are co-developing a small, light, high-output electric motor for Lilium's all-electric vertical take-off and landing ("eVTOL") jet. This collaboration marks DENSO's entry into the aerospace market and represents the first product from their formal alliance, aiming to support sustainable air mobility solutions. The e-motor is designed for exceptional performance and reliability with zero operating emissions, contributing to cleaner and more efficient transportation.

title: Lilium partners with Honeywell and DENSO to co-develop and manufacture electric motor for Lilium Jet
summary: Lilium has partnered with Honeywell and DENSO to co-develop and manufacture the electric motor for the Lilium Jet. Honeywell, already an avionics partner and investor, brings aerospace expertise, while DENSO contributes experience in high-quality volume production. This collaboration aims to produce a high-performance, lightweight, and efficient e-motor for the all-electric vertical take-off and landing ("eVTOL") jet.

title: Gilat targets narrowbodies, RJs and bizjets for ESA
summary: Gilat Satellite Networks is prioritizing narrowbody aircraft, regional jets, and business jets for the initial type certifications and deployments of its flat panel electronically steerable antenna (ESA). The company anticipates bringing the ESA to market within three years, initially targeting retrofits due to longer linefit offerability timelines for airframers. Gilat highlights its in-house engineering and manufacturing capabilities, as well as its advanced power management algorithms, as key differentiators for its ESA technology.

title: Global Smart Electric Meter Market Size to Reach USD 36.00 Billion by 2028 | Rapid Urbanization and Development of Multiple Smart Cities to Boost Smart Electric Meter Market Growth
summary: The global smart electric meter market is projected to reach USD 36.00 billion by 2028, growing from USD 20.81 billion in 2021 at a CAGR of 8.1%. This growth is attributed to rapid urbanization, the development of smart cities, and increasing adoption of renewable energy resources. The report also highlights the impact of COVID-19, market segmentation, regional insights, and competitive landscape.

title: Honeywell sees $183M first-quarter hit from suspending Russian sales
summary: Honeywell International Inc. reported a net income of $1.13 billion on $8.4 billion in revenue for the first quarter, despite forecasting a $183 million hit due to suspending sales in Russia. CEO Darius Adamczyk expects a strong year despite ongoing supply-chain and inflationary issues.

title: Waste Management investing $825M to add more renewable natural gas plants at landfills
summary: Waste Management is investing $825 million to construct 17 renewable natural gas (RNG) plants across the U.S. and Canada. This initiative aims to convert landfill gas into sustainable energy sources, significantly advancing the company's sustainability goals. A key objective is to fuel WM's entire compressed natural gas fleet with RNG by 2026.

title: Honeywell CEO receives his largest compensation package of $26.1M
summary: Honeywell CEO Darius Adamczyk received his largest compensation package yet in 2021, totaling $26.1 million. This figure, while significant for Adamczyk, is still considerably less than the record compensation received by his predecessor. The article highlights this compensation in the context of Honeywell's performance and leadership.

title: Honeywell seeking more suppliers as it works to support Boeing, Airbus plane targets
summary: Honeywell International Inc. is actively seeking to expand its supplier base to meet the anticipated higher demand from planemakers Boeing Co. and Airbus SE, as both companies ramp up production to capitalize on a surge in air travel. The aerospace parts maker aims to diversify its sources for parts and raw materials, including titanium and nickel, to ensure it can support increased aircraft output despite ongoing supply chain challenges. Honeywell states it is ready to support the production schedules of Boeing and Airbus, even though its quarterly results have been impacted by supply chain issues.

title: Honeywell doubles down on China unit
summary: Honeywell is increasing its investment and R&D capabilities in China, aligning with its "East for East" and "East to Rest" strategies. The company, in partnership with Oriental Energy Co Ltd, is building the world's largest sustainable aviation fuel production facility in Maoming, Guangdong province, aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Honeywell remains optimistic about China's economic growth and its position as the company's largest growth market.

title: 3M suspends business in Russia
summary: Industrial giant 3M Co announced it has suspended all business operations in Russia, following its re-assessment of the country's business environment after the invasion of Ukraine. This decision aligns with other Western firms and comes amidst continuous pressure from economic sanctions against the Kremlin. The company emphasized its focus on the safety of its employees and their families during these actions.

title: Honeywell implements hybrid schedule amid Atlanta hiring push
summary: Honeywell has implemented a hybrid work schedule for its 885 employees in Atlanta. This return-to-office announcement coincides with the Fortune 100 technology manufacturer's efforts to fill 250 open positions in the city. The move reflects a broader trend toward hybrid work models, particularly for high-paying roles.

title: Honeywell rolls out flexible workplace policies as employees return from remote work
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has introduced new flexible workplace policies to promote work-life balance as employees transition back to regular routines after Covid-19 closures. The company's global headquarters is located in Charlotte, and these new protocols aim to support employees returning from remote work.

title: Secure Connection announces a complete range of Honeywell Audio Products
summary: Secure Connection, a Hong Kong-based electronic products manufacturer, has launched a comprehensive range of Honeywell-branded audio products. The new lineup includes 43 products across three categories (Moxie, Suono, and Trueno) catering to different price points and performance needs, such as True Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Headphones, and Soundbars. These products will be available across South Asia, Southeast Asia, Middle East Asia, and Africa through leading retailers and online platforms.

title: Resideo acquires home security brand with borderland ties
summary: Resideo Technologies has acquired First Alert from Newell Brands for $593 million, significantly expanding its home safety product portfolio. First Alert, known for producing smoke and carbon monoxide alarms, fire extinguishers, and other safety products, has manufacturing operations in Juárez, Mexico, and a primary distribution facility in El Paso. This acquisition is expected to create operational synergies by combining First Alert's retail strength with Resideo's professional contractor relationships.

title: Exxon Mobil, LyondellBasell, others partner with city of Houston to boost plastic recycling
summary: Exxon Mobil, LyondellBasell, and other partners are collaborating with the city of Houston to enhance plastic recycling efforts. This initiative aims to increase the supply of plastic feedstock for ExxonMobil's Baytown facility, diverting plastic from landfills and into recycling streams. Dave Andrew of ExxonMobil Chemical Co. highlights that the main challenge is access to plastic feed, not investment.

title: Battery Manufacturer SES Goes Public in a SPAC Deal
summary: SES AI Corporation, a lithium-metal battery manufacturer, has completed its business combination with Ivanhoe Capital Acquisition Corporation, a SPAC, and is now trading on the NYSE under the ticker symbols ‘SES’ and ‘SES WS’. The deal was supported by a $275 million PIPE offering from major investors including Honda, General Motors, and Hyundai. This capital infusion is intended to accelerate SES's growth and fund key development initiatives for its Li-Metal battery technology.

title: Honeywell names Rajesh Rege as country president for India biz
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has appointed Rajesh Rege as country president for its India business, effective February 7th. Rege will be responsible for spearheading Honeywell's India strategy, focusing on expanding its product portfolio, driving customer engagements, and developing leadership talent for its India operations across its four strategic business groups. He brings over 32 years of corporate experience, including leadership roles at Microsoft, Red Hat, Cisco Systems, Sun Microsystems, and Wipro.

title: Honeywell partners with Navin Fluorine to add hydrofluoroolefins capacity in India
summary: Honeywell and Navin Fluorine International Limited (NFIL) have partnered to manufacture Honeywell's proprietary Solstice range of hydrofluoroolefins (HFO) in India, with production slated to begin by Q2 2022 at NFIL's Gujarat facility. These next-generation products offer no ozone depletion potential and a low global warming potential, aligning with sustainability goals and growing global demand for environmentally friendlier solutions. This "Make-in-India" initiative aims to serve global customers and develop new applications for the Indian market, strengthening the partnership between the two companies.

title: Rocky Brands opens distribution center east of Reno
summary: Rocky Brands has opened a new 350,000-square-foot distribution center east of Reno, Nevada, investing $6 million and seeking to fill approximately 40 jobs. This expansion aims to balance its Ohio operations and improve customer service nationwide, following significant growth including a $230 million acquisition of new brands in 2021. Despite supply chain challenges, the center is becoming operational and is crucial for meeting increased demand.

title: Cisco Introduces New Catalyst IE9300 switch
summary: Cisco has

title: Deos RTOS to Host Honeywell’s Next Generation Anthem Cockpit System
summary: Honeywell Aerospace has chosen DDC-I, Inc.'s Deos real-time operating system (RTOS) to host its new cloud-native Anthem cockpit system. This selection highlights Deos's advanced features, such as multicore capabilities and efficient processing, which will help Anthem meet safety objectives and reduce certification costs. Anthem's launch customers include electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft developers Lilium and Vertical Aerospace, with certification timelines targeted for 2023 and 2024.

title: Honeywell’s new HQ tower in uptown sells for $275M
summary: Honeywell's new 374,000-square-foot headquarters building in uptown Charlotte sold for $275 million, making it the second-most expensive office building sale per square foot in Charlotte's history at roughly $735 per square foot. A fund managed by Goldman Sachs, Honeywell International Inc., and Lincoln Harris sold the 23-story building to PRP Real Estate Investment Management. This sale follows the Lowe’s Global Technology Center sale for $318 million in November, which set a new record for price per square foot.

title: Goldman Sachs, Lincoln Harris, Honeywell JV Sells Newest Charlotte Legacy Union Office Building
summary: A joint venture involving Goldman Sachs, Lincoln Harris, and Honeywell has sold the Honeywell Global Corporate headquarters building at Charlotte Legacy Union to real estate investment management company PRP. The newly completed 23-story building, which houses Honeywell's global headquarters, features 330,000 square feet of Class A office space and an array of modern amenities and technologies. This sale highlights Charlotte's appeal for major corporations, further evidenced by Honeywell's positive remarks on its relocation to the city.

title: Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Lincoln Harris and Honeywell Sell 374,000-Square-Foot Honeywell Global Corporate HQ at Charlotte's Legacy Union to PRP Real Estate Investment Management
summary: A fund managed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management's Real Estate business, Lincoln Harris, and Honeywell International Inc. have sold the 374,000-square-foot Honeywell Global Corporate Headquarters at Charlotte's Legacy Union to PRP Real Estate Investment Management. The 23-story building, which opened earlier this year, is the global headquarters of Fortune 100 technology company Honeywell International Inc., which is in the first year of a 15-year lease. Lincoln Harris will continue to manage and lease the property, which is located in a prime Charlotte location.

title: Vertical Aerospace Lists on NYSE Following Merger with Broadstone Acquisition Corp.
summary: Vertical Aerospace announced the closing of its business combination with Broadstone Acquisition Corp. and its listing on the NYSE under the ticker EVTL. The company aims to pioneer zero-carbon aviation with its VX4 electric aircraft, backed by significant funding and pre-orders from major airlines, targeting certification by 2024. This milestone marks a significant step towards commercial operations in the mid-2020s, with strong support from key partners and investors.

title: Honeywell Reaches $10 Million Settlement With Investors To Resolve Claims It Understated Asbestos-Related Liabilities
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has agreed to a $10 million settlement with investors to resolve claims that the company understated its asbestos-related liabilities. The 2018 class action lawsuit centered on Honeywell's 1999 acquisition of Bendix Friction Materials, which exposed it to significant asbestos-related liabilities due to Bendix's use of asbestos in its products. Investors alleged that Honeywell misrepresented its liabilities as $616 million, while the actual figure was closer to $1.7 billion, leading to a decline in stock price.

title: Residential HVAC Market size to grow by USD 33.02 Bn | Dominated by Carrier Global Corp. and Daikin Industries Ltd. | Technavio
summary: The global residential HVAC market is projected to grow by USD 33.02 billion, expanding at a CAGR of 8.46% during the forecast period from 2021-2025. This growth is driven by increasing residential construction, rising urbanization, and the availability of energy-efficient systems, with APAC holding the largest market share. The market is dominated by key players such as Carrier Global Corp. and Daikin Industries Ltd.

title: Space infrastructure company Loft Orbital raises $140 million from BlackRock and others
summary: Loft Orbital, a space infrastructure start-up, secured $140 million in a new funding round led by BlackRock. The company, which provides "space-infrastructure-as-a-service," plans to use the capital to scale its business and double its team by the end of 2022. Loft Orbital aims to significantly reduce the time it takes for customers to get payloads into space by pre-building spacecraft.

title: Honeywell execs on what shaped design of new uptown HQ
summary: Honeywell executives discussed the design process behind their new 23-story, 1,000-employee global headquarters in uptown Charlotte. The article highlights the official opening of the headquarters on December 1st with CEO Darius Adamczyk, Governor Roy Cooper, and Mayor Vi Lyles.

title: New range of Honeywell Air Purifiers launched
summary: Secure Connection, a Hong Kong-based electronic products manufacturer, has launched a new range of Honeywell Branded Air Purifiers. This new line includes Value, Platinum, and Ultimate Series, featuring functionalities like UV LED, Ionizer, and Humidifier, and is equipped with HEPA H13 filters capable of cleaning 99.97% of particles down to 0.3 microns. These purifiers will be available across South Asia and Middle East Asia through retailers and online platforms to address rising air pollution concerns.

title: Honeywell CEO praises new headquarters city while hinting at more growth ahead
summary: Honeywell CEO Darius Adamczyk expressed satisfaction with the company's move to Charlotte from New Jersey, following the official opening of their new 23-story global headquarters. The CEO hinted at potential future growth for the company in the rapidly developing city. The opening was attended by Governor Roy Cooper, Mayor Vi Lyles, and other VIPs.

title: Resideo Adds Amazon Smart Thermostat to Utility Programs
summary: Resideo announced that the Amazon Smart Thermostat will be integrated into its Connected Savings® portfolio, allowing utility customers to participate in rewards programs. Built with Honeywell Home Thermostat Technology, this integration aims to enhance grid reliability and promote energy savings. Resideo and Amazon are partnering to drive enrollments in energy efficiency programs, supporting green energy initiatives and helping utilities achieve net-zero goals.

title: Honeywell Is Turning Low-Grade Plastic Waste Into High-Quality Oil
summary: Honeywell (HON) has developed a commercially viable method to convert low-grade plastic waste into high-quality oil suitable for refining. The company is partnering with Sacyr SA to construct a plant designed to process 30,000 metric tons of mixed plastic trash annually into refinery feedstock. This innovation aims to address plastic waste by transforming it into a valuable resource.

title: Ecobee acquired by generator company Generac for $770 million
summary: Generac Holdings has acquired Toronto-based smart home thermostat company Ecobee for $770 million, with the deal expected to close in the fourth quarter. Ecobee's CEO and founder, Stuart Lombard, will continue in his role, and the company will operate as a subsidiary of Generac, expanding its Toronto office. This acquisition combines Ecobee's smart home technology with Generac's energy management solutions, aiming to create a comprehensive home energy ecosystem.

title: Jeld-Wen elects Michel as chairman of the board
summary: Jeld-Wen announced that its President and CEO, Gary Michel, has been elected chairman of the board, effective immediately. Michel, who joined Jeld-Wen in 2018, replaces Matthew Ross. Additionally, Suzanne Stefany has been appointed lead independent director.

title: Honeywell raises outlook for business jet deliveries as demand rebounds
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has increased its outlook for business jet deliveries, forecasting up to 7,400 new deliveries worth $238 billion from 2022 to 2031. This positive adjustment reflects a rebound in the aviation sector as COVID-19 restrictions ease and wealthy travelers seek private flight options, leading to increased demand for both new and used corporate aircraft.

title: Honeywell, Wood launch technologies for sustainable aviation fuel
summary: Honeywell International, Inc. and Wood plc have introduced a comprehensive package of technologies designed to produce carbon-neutral aviation fuel. By combining Honeywell’s UOP Ecofining process technology with Wood’s hydrogen plant technology, the combined solution can reduce lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions by up to 100% using specific feedstocks compared to traditional petroleum aviation fuel. This collaboration aims to help fuel producers reduce operating costs and meet sustainability goals.

title: Gogoro, a Technology Leader in Urban Electric Mobility and
summary: Gogoro, a leader in urban electric mobility, announced its plan to go public on Nasdaq through a merger with Poema Global Holdings Corp., valuing Gogoro at $2.35 billion. The transaction is expected to provide approximately $550 million in proceeds for global expansion and R&D, with strategic partners like Foxconn and GoTo Group investing in a PIPE. The combined company, to be named Gogoro Inc., aims to accelerate the global expansion of its battery swapping service in markets such as China, India, and Southeast Asia.

title: United, Honeywell Invest in New Clean Tech Venture from Alder Fuels, Powering Biggest Sustainable Fuel Agreement in Aviation History
summary: United Airlines and Honeywell have jointly invested in Alder Fuels, a cleantech company developing technology to produce sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) from biomass. United has committed to purchase 1.5 billion gallons of SAF from Alder, making it the largest publicly announced SAF agreement in aviation history. This collaboration aims to accelerate large-scale SAF production and contribute to a zero-carbon economy.

title: What’s Next For 3M Stock After A 5% Fall In A Week?
summary: This article analyzes the recent 5.4% drop in 3M stock price over the past week and uses a machine learning engine to predict its future movement. It suggests that historically, a 5% drop in 3M stock often leads to an average 2.3% gain in the subsequent month. The article also provides updated insights based on 3M's Q2 2021 earnings, which exceeded expectations, leading to a revised full-year outlook and a slightly increased valuation.

title: Honeywell's Christine Feuell to lead Chrysler at Stellantis with its 10-year chance
summary: Christine Feuell, formerly of Honeywell, has been appointed CEO of Chrysler at Stellantis, effective September 13. Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares has given Chrysler 10 years to prove its profitability and growth, following the brand's long-standing identity crisis. Feuell brings extensive experience in marketing and strategic growth from previous roles at Ford, Johnson Controls, and Honeywell.

title: Cigna moving to ex-Honeywell campus in Morris Plains, reportedly leasing 200,000 sq. ft.
summary: Cigna Corp. is set to lease approximately 200,000 square feet of the former Honeywell International campus at 115 Tabor Road in Morris Plains, relocating around 2,100 employees, primarily from its Evernorth subsidiary. This move will backfill nearly half of the 465,000-square-foot property acquired by Argent Ventures LLC. The new Morris Plains office will serve as the future home for Evernorth, including the Express Scripts brand, offering a mix of on-site, flex, and work-from-home options.

title: Textron launches new data communications program to support legacy Hawker 4000 & Citation Sovereign aircraft
summary: Textron Aviation and Honeywell Aerospace have partnered to develop a new data communications program for Hawker 4000 and Cessna Citation Sovereign aircraft equipped with the Honeywell PRIMUS EPIC integrated cockpit. This upgrade will enable easier communication between pilots and air traffic controllers using advanced Data Link services, similar to text messaging, and is expected to be available in mid-2022. The program aims to improve operational efficiency, reduce communication errors, and modernize capabilities for these aircraft in North America and Europe.

title: Honeywell moves Performance Materials and Technologies HQ to Houston
summary: Honeywell's Performance Materials and Technologies unit has relocated its headquarters to Houston, co-locating within the company's existing offices on the CityWestPlace campus. This move is attributed to the presence of many of the unit's customers in the oil and gas industry, a key sector in Houston.

title: CBJ Morning Buzz: Honeywell CEO talks return to offices and more; Singer's $1.5M NC home hits market
summary: This article provides a quick morning update, highlighting Honeywell CEO Darius Adamczyk's discussion on returning to offices and business travel. It also mentions a local brewery's expansion, a restaurant closure, mask mandates for Charlotte employers, nondiscrimination measures, and the impact of investors on local homebuyers.

title: Building a sustainable world that works for all | GE News
summary: GE released its 2021 Sustainability Report, outlining its commitment to becoming a net-zero company by 2050 and addressing global demand for energy, healthcare, and aviation sustainably. The report emphasizes the need for lower-carbon energy solutions, precision healthcare, and more efficient aviation to meet current and future needs while reducing environmental impact. GE highlights its use of lean methodology and $3.8 billion in R&D investment in 2020 to drive breakthrough sustainable technologies.

title: Former Honeywell building at Eisenhower Airport set for new supplier
summary: A former Honeywell facility at Wichita Eisenhower National Airport will soon be occupied by a new aerospace supplier, Millennium Concepts. Honeywell previously vacated the building in 2019 as part of a move to Olathe. Millennium Concepts is expanding to increase its production capacity.

title: India Inc. On The Move
summary: This article details the "India Inc. On The Move" virtual event, in collaboration with Rockwell Automation, bringing together manufacturing industry leaders to discuss building smart manufacturing ecosystems. The event, held on August 26-27, focuses on leveraging technology, AI, Big Data, IoT, and automation to turn India into a global manufacturing hub and achieve "Aatma Nirbhar" status. It covers various sector-specific sessions and features a comprehensive agenda with numerous speakers from top companies and organizations.

title: China Baowu Steel Group Teams up with Honeywell on Hydrogen Production
summary: China Baowu Steel Group has partnered with Honeywell to collaborate on hydrogen production. This partnership aims to leverage expertise from both companies to advance hydrogen energy initiatives. The collaboration signifies a move towards sustainable energy solutions within the industrial sector.

title: Fire Protection Systems Market Revenue to Observe 5.5% Gains to 2027
summary: The global fire protection systems market is projected to surpass USD 70 billion by 2027, driven by industrialization, urbanization in APAC, and increased corporate strategies by major players. Honeywell's CLSS platform and rising awareness of fire safety in residential and heritage sites are key contributors to this growth. The article highlights the importance of innovation in fire safety to diagnose issues and monitor systems remotely.

title: Top 5 Industrial Automation Companies in the World [2021]
summary: This article identifies the top five industrial automation companies in 2021, highlighting their significant contributions and market positions. It also discusses the global industrial automation market's projected growth to USD 326.14 billion by 2027, driven by AI and wireless technology, and the accelerated adoption of automation post-COVID-19. The article provides company profiles for ABB Ltd., General Electric Company, Honeywell International, Inc., Mitsubishi Electric Corporation, and Rockwell Automation, Inc., detailing their key operations, revenue, and recent innovations.

title: G.M. will increase investment in electric vehicles by 30 percent and build more battery plants. (Published 2021)
summary: General Motors announced a significant acceleration in its electric vehicle plans, increasing investment to $35 billion by 2025 and projecting the construction of two more battery plants in the U.S. This strategic shift is a response to increasing EV adoption and competitive moves from rivals like Ford and Volkswagen, with GM aiming to sell one million EVs annually by 2025 and transition to an all-electric lineup by 2035. The company also reported an improved operating profit forecast for the first half of the year due to better chip supplies and strong demand.

title: Sensing Better Health: Complete Guide to Medical Sensors - Benefits and Applications
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide to medical sensors, detailing their critical role in various medical devices and healthcare settings, including hospitals and home care. It explains how these sensors are advancing the healthcare industry by enabling smaller, smarter, and more affordable devices for faster diagnosis, better treatments, and improved patient care. The article also outlines the benefits of home health monitoring and lists specific applications of Honeywell's sensing technology in devices like anesthesia machines, ventilators, dialysis machines, and infusion pumps.

title: Vertical Aerospace to go public in $2.2 billion SPAC deal
summary: Vertical Aerospace, an eVTOL aircraft maker, is set to go public through a merger with a blank-check firm in a deal valued at $2.2 billion. The company has secured pre-orders for up to 1,000 aircraft from customers like American Airlines and Avolon, totaling up to $4 billion. This move reflects a growing investment in zero-emission electric aircraft amid pressure for the aviation sector to decarbonize.

title: International partners and Government agencies join Arqit's Federated Quantum System
summary: Arqit Limited announced the formation of an international consortium of companies and government organizations to provide its quantum encryption technology, known as Federated Quantum System (FQS), to government customers. The system, developed with support from the UK Space Agency, aims to offer sovereign protection of strategic national assets and interoperability for joint operations among allied nations, starting with key partners including the UK, USA, Japan, Canada, Italy, Belgium, and Austria. FQS uses satellites to distribute quantum keys via a patented protocol and a method called QuantumCloud™ to deliver benefits to any endpoint or cloud machine.

title: Honeywell Quantum, Cambridge Quantum Computing form joint venture
summary: Honeywell International Inc. and Cambridge Quantum Computing (CQC) are forming a joint venture, integrating Honeywell's quantum computer unit with CQC's software. Honeywell will invest between $270 million and $300 million for a 54% stake in the new company, with CQC and its investors holding the remainder. This partnership aims to accelerate the development of quantum solutions for customers, combining hardware and software expertise in the rapidly growing quantum computing sector.

title: Denso, Honeywell Join to Make Motors for New Electric Aircraft
summary: Denso Corp. and Honeywell International Inc. have announced a 10-year partnership to produce electric motors for new aircraft designed for urban air mobility. This collaboration aims to tap into a market estimated to be worth $120 billion by 2030, with the first motors expected for flight tests by next year.

title: Top 10 Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) Companies in the World, 2021
summary: This article lists the top 10 Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) companies in 2021, highlighting their contributions to the industry, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. It discusses the historical use of PPE, the projected global market size of USD 92.86 billion by 2027, and the impact of the pandemic on establishing domestic supply chains. The article also touches upon future trends like nanomaterials and wearable PPE.

title: Honeywell donates $1M to new Main Library in uptown for innovation lab
summary: Honeywell, a company recently headquartered in Charlotte, has donated $1 million to the new Main Library project in uptown. This investment will support the creation of an innovation lab within the library. The Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is aiming to raise $70 million for the new uptown facility.

title: Global Magneto Resistive Random-Access Memory (MRAM) Market
summary: The global Magneto Resistive Random-Access Memory (MRAM) market is projected to grow from USD 1.02 billion in 2019 to USD 25.82 billion by 2027, exhibiting a CAGR of 49.60%. A new report from Fior Markets provides a comprehensive analysis of the market, including growth drivers, restraints, opportunities, and key players such as Intel, Honeywell, Toshiba, and Samsung. The study segments the market by type (Spin-Transfer Torque, Toggle) and application (Automotive, Consumer Electronics, Enterprise Storage, Aerospace, Robotics).

title: Alleged Aerospace Export Violations by Honeywell Lead to $13 Million Settlement Following Voluntary Self-Disclosure
summary: Honeywell International Inc. settled with the U.S. government for $13 million over alleged export control violations concerning aerospace and defense technical data. The settlement, which involved 34 violations of the Arms Export Control Act and ITAR, came after Honeywell's voluntary self-disclosure and cooperation. This case highlights the significant value the Biden Administration places on corporate candor and cooperation for mitigating penalties related to international trade compliance.

title: Jessica Alba's Honest Co. surges in Nasdaq debut
summary: Jessica Alba's eco-friendly personal care brand, Honest Co. (HNST), saw its shares surge 44% in its Nasdaq debut, closing at $23 per share and giving the company a market value of about $2.1 billion. CEO Nick Vlahos viewed the successful IPO as validation of the company's mission-driven strategy focused on clean, sustainable, and socially responsible products. Despite its growth in sales to over $300 million in 2020 and narrowing net losses, the company has not yet turned a profit and has previously faced controversial lawsuits regarding its product labeling.

title: Carey Smith to Lead Parsons as CEO, Chuck Harrington Retires
summary: Carey Smith has been elected CEO of Parsons Corp., effective July 1, succeeding Charles "Chuck" Harrington, who is retiring after 40 years with the company. Harrington will transition to executive chairman of the board, while Smith, who joined Parsons in 2016, will lead the company's continued growth after her key roles as COO and president. The leadership change is seen as a smooth transition, leveraging Smith's strategic vision and Harrington's ongoing contribution.

title: Parsons Announces CEO Transition
summary: Parsons Corporation announced a CEO transition, with Carey Smith succeeding Charles "Chuck" Harrington, effective July 1st, 2021. Harrington will retire after nearly 40 years with the company but will remain on the Board of Directors as executive chairman. Smith, who joined Parsons in 2016 and served as COO, is recognized for her leadership in driving growth and acquisitions.

title: Honeywell CEO earns $19.1M compensation package in 2020
summary: Honeywell CEO Darius Adamczyk received a $19.1 million compensation package in 2020, a decrease of approximately $1.5 million from the previous year. This reduction was primarily due to Honeywell International Inc. missing some financial targets amid the Covid-related economic slowdown. Despite the financial challenges, the company stated that Adamczyk's response to the pandemic allowed Honeywell to outperform the median financial performance of its peer group in several categories.

title: SHAREHOLDER ALERT: Barr Law Group Investigating REZI, MMSI,
summary: Barr Law Group is investigating Resideo Technologies, Inc. (REZI), Merit Medical Systems, Inc. (MMSI), Lordstown Motors Corporation (RIDE), and Principal Real Estate Income Fund (PGZ) for potential violations of securities laws and breaches of fiduciary duties. The investigations follow developments such as denial of motions to dismiss in existing class actions and reports of misleading statements or operational issues. Shareholders of these companies are encouraged to contact the firm for more information regarding their legal rights.

title: Selling military goods to the United States
summary: This article examines the top 10 Canadian military suppliers that secured the most contracts brokered by the Canadian Commercial Corporation (CCC) with the United States in FY2020. The CCC, Canada's largest arms broker, facilitates contracts between Canadian manufacturers and foreign governments, with 60-70% of these involving military goods. The report details over $876 million CAD in contracts, highlighting companies like General Dynamics Ordnance and Tactical Systems-Canada, L3Harris WESCAM Inc., and General Dynamics Land Systems-Canada, outlining the military goods and services they provide to the U.S. military.

title: Rocky Brands Completes Acquisition Of Honeywell’s Boot Business
summary: Rocky Brands Inc. has completed its acquisition of Honeywell International, Inc.'s performance and lifestyle footwear business for $230 million. This acquisition includes prominent brands like The Original Muck Boot Company and XtraTuf, and is expected to nearly double Rocky Brands' annual revenues. The deal was financed through asset-backed credit facilities and cash on hand.

title: Antonov Reducing Dependence on Russian-made Components in its Airplanes
summary: Antonov, the Ukrainian aircraft manufacturer, is reducing its reliance on Russian-made components by purchasing avionics equipment from Honeywell International Inc. The company has ordered four units of the TCAS-II (Traffic Collision Avoidance System), mod. CAS-100B, for a total cost of USD 1,142,668, with deliveries expected within 120 days of advance payment. This move highlights Ukraine's efforts to enhance its defense industrial independence.

title: U.S. Army awards $476 million contract to Honeywell for CH-47 engines
