This new plant, along with an existing facility in Rhode Island, will produce masks for healthcare workers and supply 20 million masks to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. The company's CEO, Darius Adamczyk, expressed pride in their role in providing essential equipment during the crisis.

title: Honeywell to make crucial N95 protective masks in Phoenix, hire 500
summary: Honeywell announced plans to convert an aerospace facility in Phoenix to produce N95 protective masks by mid-May to address the coronavirus crisis, creating 500 new jobs. This initiative is a direct response to the urgent demand for healthcare masks during the pandemic.

title: StandardAero Launches Engine Exchange Program
summary: StandardAero has launched an engine exchange program allowing owners to swap their current engines or purchase replacements with less flight time to prolong aircraft life. The program currently covers Honeywell TFE731, CFE738, and Pratt & Whitney PW305 turbofans, as well as Honeywell 36-100/150 series APUs. This initiative aims to extend the operational life of aircraft for their owners.

title: Honeywell plans unpaid leave for employees, pay cuts for executives during coronavirus pandemic
summary: Honeywell announced plans for two-week unpaid furloughs for all employees in April and May, while executives, including CEO Darius Adamczyk, will face 10% base-salary cuts and significantly reduced incentive pay. These measures are being implemented in response to the economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: 17 Stocks With Fortress Balance Sheets
summary: This article identifies 17 stocks with strong balance sheets, dubbed "fortress balance sheets," that are well-positioned to withstand economic downturns and are currently undervalued. It highlights three specific companies—Coca-Cola, Honeywell, and Public Service Enterprise Group—providing detailed analyst commentary on their financial resilience and market positioning amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. The piece serves as a guide for investors looking for sturdy companies during market uncertainty.

title: Honeywell ramping up N95 mask production in Rhode Island
summary: Honeywell International Inc. is significantly expanding N95 medical mask production at its Smithfield, R.I., plant, adding at least 500 new jobs in response to the coronavirus crisis. This expansion will supply the U.S. Strategic National Stockpile with masks, which contain polypropylene fiber mesh and filter 95 percent of airborne particles. The company is also increasing production at other global sites and reported sales of $36.7 billion in 2019.

title: James Taiclet Named Lockheed Martin President, CEO
summary: Lockheed Martin announced James Taiclet has been elected as its new president and CEO, effective June 15, succeeding Marillyn Hewson. Taiclet, previously CEO of American Tower Corp. and a Lockheed Martin board member since 2018, will continue to serve on the board. Marillyn Hewson will transition to executive chair, and other leadership changes include Frank St. John as COO and Stephanie Hill as EVP of Rotary and Mission Systems.

title: Honeywell CEO's compensation totals more than $20M in 2019
summary: Honeywell International Inc.'s CEO, Darius Adamczyk, received over $20 million in total compensation in 2019, marking his highest compensation in his three years leading the company. Honeywell is now based in Charlotte.

title: Lockheed Martin's Marillyn Hewson to step down as CEO
summary: Marillyn Hewson, a long-serving chief executive of Lockheed Martin, is set to step down from her role and will be replaced by James Taiclet, CEO of American Tower Corp. Hewson has led the company since 2013, overseeing significant stock gains and the expansion of the F-35 fighter jet program. She will remain with Lockheed as executive chairman.

title: Personal Protective Equipment Market Size, Share & Forecast 2033
summary: The global Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) market was valued at USD 85.63 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach USD 158.75 billion by 2033, growing at a CAGR of 7.1%. Key growth drivers include occupational safety concerns, innovations in comfortable PPE, and stringent regulatory frameworks for worker safety. North America currently holds the largest market share, while Europe is identified as the fastest-growing region, driven by increasing industrial activities and awareness regarding worker safety.

title: Honeywell to Roll Out Quantum Computer
summary: Honeywell International Inc. announced its plan to release an early-stage quantum computer for commercial experiments within three months, with JPMorgan Chase & Co. as its first public user. The company claims this machine will be the world's most powerful quantum computer by one measure, positioning Honeywell as a competitor against tech giants like IBM, Google, and Microsoft in the developing quantum-computing market.

title: Humanoid Robot Market Demand, Current Outlook, Future Growth,
summary: The humanoid robot market is experiencing significant growth driven by increasing adoption in retail, education, research, and caregiving, as well as technological advancements. Software is expected to dominate the market due to the integration of AI algorithms, while biped motion types also hold a significant share. North America currently leads the market, but the Asia-Pacific region is projected to show the fastest growth.

title: Connected worker platforms bring people into digital transformation
summary: The article discusses how connected worker platforms are integrating front-line industrial workers into digital transformation initiatives, bridging gaps left by traditional ERP and manufacturing systems. These platforms, offered by vendors like Parsable, SAP, Honeywell, and Oracle, utilize next-generation technologies such as IoT analytics and AI to improve worker efficiency and collaboration. Grupo Lala, a dairy production company, successfully implemented Parsable's platform to capture metadata on how procedures are performed, realize paper savings, and increase worker engagement.

title: Sealed Air looks to automation, innovation to spur growth amid rising coronavirus worries
summary: Sealed Air CEO Ted Doheny discusses the impact of the coronavirus on the company's operations, noting that some customers seek extra orders while others slow down due to supply chain issues. Despite these challenges, the company is focusing on automation and innovation to drive growth. Doheny acknowledges the "fear is real" regarding the virus's spread, though none of Sealed Air's overseas operations are currently closed.

title: Clearwater subcontractor gets a piece of $200M Draper missile contract
summary: A portion of a $200 million missile contract awarded to Draper will be completed in Clearwater, Florida, benefiting a local subcontractor. This highlights Florida's significant military and defense industry impact. The article mentions related defense contracts and job opportunities in the region.

title: Gilat outlines plan for supporting IFC with low-profile ESA
summary: Gilat Satellite Networks believes it is well-positioned to secure a significant share of the inflight connectivity (IFC) market with its electronically steered antenna (ESA), which has successfully supported broadband transmissions via LEO and GEO satellites in Ka-band. While acknowledging that the transition to conformal ESAs in aviation will take time, Gilat highlights that its ESA technology is ready and expects immediate demand in the business aviation sector. The company also notes its support for open architecture and standardization within the industry and its capability to work with multiple non-geostationary orbit (NGSO) constellations.

title: Honeywell heats up pension plan with $112 million contribution
summary: Honeywell has announced a significant contribution of $112 million to its pension plan. This move aims to strengthen the company's pension fund, as reported by Pensions & Investments.

title: Pipeline Monitoring System Market Outlines the Growth Factors
summary: The Pipeline Monitoring System Market is expected to grow due to factors like increased oil & gas leakage, government regulations, and the need to avoid large storage tanks. North America is projected to dominate the market, followed by Asia Pacific and Europe, with Ultrasonic Technology expected to be the leading segment. Key companies like General Electric and Siemens AG are focusing on organic and inorganic growth strategies.

title: US mulls blocking GE from selling jet engines to China: Report
summary: The US government is considering stopping General Electric (GE) from supplying jet engines to China for its new passenger jet, the COMAC C919, out of concern that it could boost a rival to Boeing or enhance China's military capabilities. This potential restriction, along with limits on other components like flight control systems from Honeywell, marks a significant reversal of previous US policy that supported American companies' dealings with China's civil aviation sector. The issue is expected to be discussed at interagency meetings, and China could retaliate by ordering more planes from Airbus if the US proceeds with the measure.

title: Deal gives county 40 acres of parkland on Onondaga Lake (exclusive)
summary: Onondaga County is set to acquire over 40 acres of new parkland on Onondaga Lake's shore through an agreement with Honeywell International Inc. Honeywell will also provide $625,000 and complete a biking/walking trail. This deal, pending legislative approval, amends a 2004 legal agreement regarding the lake's cleanup, ensuring public access to the waterfront for the first time in a century and addressing potential development concerns.

title: NEWSMAKER: What Honeywell's CTO sees for company's tech growth here
summary: Suresh Venkatarayalu, Honeywell's CTO, views Charlotte as a crucial location for the company's technological growth and was instrumental in the decision to move the headquarters there. His perspective was highlighted at the new Future Lab presented by Honeywell at Discovery Place. The article suggests Charlotte provides fertile ground for Honeywell's tech initiatives.

title: Pipeline Network Market to global analysis and forecasts by geography trending
summary: This article provides an analysis of the global Pipeline Network Market, forecasting its growth and highlighting key vendors such as ABB, Emerson, and Siemens. The report delves into market segmentation by offering, application, content, and end-user industry, emphasizing the rising demand for pipeline networks due to increased oil and gas consumption and the need to minimize leaks. It also covers growth strategies adopted by market players, including organic and inorganic approaches.

title: Aircraft Airframe Fuel Systems Market 2020 Future Trends, Dynamic Growth & Forecast To 2028 | Eaton Corporation Plc, Parker Hannifin Corporation, United Technologies Corporation, Triumph Group, Zodiac Aerospace., GKN Plc, Honeywell International, Inc. and
summary: This article details a market report on the Aircraft Airframe Fuel Systems Market, providing a comprehensive assessment of market dynamics, historical and current growth parameters, and future expectations. It segments the market by aircraft type, engine type, component type, and technology type, and profiles key companies while also discussing regional distribution and growth prospects. The report aims to help companies adjust their strategies for maximum growth within the forecast period up to 2028.

title: Honeywell Aerospace, 2 startups partner to combat counterfeit parts market
summary: Honeywell Aerospace has partnered with two startups to implement a first-of-its-kind blockchain-based process for tracking airplane parts. This initiative aims to combat the counterfeit parts market by increasing transparency and simplifying supply-chain operations. The new system will allow Honeywell to track parts and activate authenticity records on its digital ledger, a critical countermeasure in the aerospace industry.

title: With Smart Devices and Pro Network, Resideo Could be AAA for the Home
summary: Resideo, a spin-off from Honeywell, is poised to become the "AAA for the home" by offering comprehensive remote monitoring and home services through smart devices, cloud services, and a network of professionals. The company has acquired three startups—LifeWhere, Whisker Labs, and Buoy Labs—to expand its predictive analytics capabilities for home appliances, HVAC, and water management. With its existing infrastructure, including professional monitoring and a broad dealer network, Resideo aims to integrate these new services and address critical home networks (water, air, energy, security) proactively, offering subscription-based protection and maintenance.

title: Charlotte-based Honeywell acquires fast-growing Houston energy tech company
summary: Charlotte-based Honeywell has acquired a fast-growing energy technology company based in Houston. This acquisition follows Honeywell's relocation of its headquarters to Charlotte earlier in the year. The Houston company had been recognized for its rapid growth over the past decade.

title: Press Release: Gilat’s ESA terminal demos on Honeywell 757 testbed
summary: Gilat Satellite Networks announced that its In-Flight Connectivity (IFC) Electronically Steered Antenna (ESA) successfully operated during an in-flight demonstration on a Honeywell Boeing 757 test aircraft. The ESA terminal, operating over Telesat's Telstar 19 VANTAGE HTS, demonstrated remarkable performance with complete gate-to-gate operation and showcased Gilat's innovation in next-generation IFC technology for both commercial and smaller jets.

title: Garrett Motion Sues Honeywell
summary: Garrett Motion Inc. has filed a lawsuit against Honeywell International Inc. in the Supreme Court of the State of New York. The lawsuit alleges that Honeywell unilaterally imposed an "unusual 30-year Indemnification Agreement" on Garrett immediately prior to its spin-off in October 2018. Garrett asserts that this agreement, which requires it to compensate Honeywell for asbestos exposure related to Honeywell's legacy Bendix automotive brake business, is unacceptable and limits Garrett’s ability to reach its full potential.

title: Exclusive: Former Honeywell CEO in bid talks for Vertiv - sources
summary: Former Honeywell International Inc CEO David Cote's company, GS Acquisition Holdings Corp, backed by Goldman Sachs, is in talks to acquire U.S. backup power equipment firm Vertiv for over $5 billion, including debt. Vertiv, previously part of Emerson Electric and later acquired by Platinum Equity, manufactures systems for data centers and communication networks. The negotiations are ongoing, and other potential bidders have also shown interest.

title: Honeywell Spinoff Sues Former Parent Over Asbestos Liabilities
summary: Garrett Motion Inc., a spinoff from Honeywell International Inc., is suing its former parent company. Garrett alleges that it was forced into a burdensome agreement concerning asbestos liabilities. The lawsuit seeks to nullify the agreement which requires Garrett to make payments back to Honeywell.

title: 20 Things You Didn’t Know About Sasan Goodarzi
summary: This article details 20 facts about Sasan Goodarzi, the CEO of Intuit, covering his educational background, career trajectory, financial success, and personal life. It highlights his progression from electrical engineering to leading a major software company, his significant net worth and stock holdings, and his philanthropic activities with his wife.

title: What’s Changed: 2019 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Manufacturing Execution Systems
summary: Gartner's 2019 Magic Quadrant for Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) highlights a mature yet innovative market, with vendors continuously improving products and exploring new technologies like cloud adoption and microservices. The report evaluates 16 providers, revealing changes in inclusion criteria, new entrants like Parsec and Sepasoft, and updated vendor standings in the Leaders, Challengers, Visionaries, and Niche Players quadrants. Key players like Rockwell Automation, Oracle, and Dassault Systemes are recognized for their strengths and advancements in the MES landscape.

title: Construction Company Caterpillar Wants To Mine the Moon
summary: Construction giant Caterpillar is exploring the possibility of adapting its autonomous mining technology for use on the moon. This initiative comes as NASA continues to invest in in-situ resource utilization for future lunar missions, aiming to convert mined materials on location to support a sustainable presence on the moon. The technology, which has significantly improved safety and productivity in terrestrial mining, faces new challenges in the space environment, such as cosmic radiation and micrometeorite strikes.

title: Industrial Automation Market is expected to reach USD 269.5
summary: The Industrial Automation Market is projected to reach USD 269.5 billion by 2024, growing at a CAGR of 9.08% from USD 160.0 billion in 2018. A study by HTF Market Intelligence Consulting Pvt. Ltd. provides a deep assessment of the market, including future trends, growth factors, and profiles of key players like Emerson, Schneider Electric, and Rockwell Automation. The report segments the market by product types such as SCADA, PLC, HMI, DCS, and Safety Automation, and by applications including Proven Reserves and Offshore Production of Oil & Gas.

title: Flying Colours completes Honeywell Primus Elite upgrade on Global Express
summary: Flying Colours Corp. has completed a dual avionics upgrade on a Bombardier Global Express, integrating the Honeywell Primus Elite flight-deck and the Honeywell JetWave Ka-band system. This two-phase project enhanced the aircraft's situational awareness for the crew with new displays and provided high-speed broadband connectivity for passengers. The upgrade addressed CRT obsolescence, improved operational efficiency, and significantly enhanced in-flight connectivity capabilities.

title: Diamond Green Diesel Expanding Biodiesel Production In Louisiana
summary: Diamond Green Diesel plans to expand its renewable diesel production capacity in Norco, Louisiana, using Honeywell UOP's Ecofining process technology. This $1.1 billion expansion will increase the facility's annual production by nearly 150 percent to 675 million gallons, making it one of the world's largest renewable diesel plants. The expansion aims to meet growing demand for renewable fuels in North America and Europe, and will also produce renewable naphtha.

title: Northrop Grumman selects subcontractors for new ICBM missile system
summary: Northrop Grumman has announced the subcontractors for its Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) missile system, including major companies like Aerojet Rocketdyne, Lockheed Martin, and General Dynamics. This announcement follows Northrop Grumman's rejection of a partnership with Boeing for the project. The GBSD system, estimated to cost $85 billion over 50 years, is intended to replace the U.S. Air Force's Minuteman III missiles.

title: Army Awards Honeywell with Additional $111M for TIGER Hardware on Abrams Tanks
summary: The U.S. Army awarded Honeywell International Inc. an additional $110.87 million modification to an existing contract for Total Integrated Engine Revitalization (TIGER) hardware for Abrams tanks. This funding will support production at the Anniston Army Depot for the Advanced Gas Turbine 1500 engine and TIGER field repair site requirements. The article also details other significant defense contracts awarded by the Army, Navy, Defense Health Agency, Defense Logistics Agency, and U.S. Transportation Command.

title: Craig Cuyar, Omnicom Group technology executive council
summary: This article introduces Craig Cuyar, Senior Vice President and Global Chief Information Officer at Omnicom Group, as a member of CNBC's Technology Executive Council. It highlights his role in global IT transformation, focusing on strategies for optimization, innovation, and revenue growth. The article also details his professional background, achievements, and academic affiliations, including his role as an adjunct Professor at Columbia University.

title: Could Your Cell Phone Really Crash Your Flight? On 2 Popular Boeing Jets, There’s a Risk
summary: A 2014 FAA safety bulletin revealed that passenger mobile phones and other radio signals could pose a crash threat to some Boeing 737 and 777 airplanes due to potential interference with cockpit screens. The FAA mandated that airlines replace units made by Honeywell International Inc. by November 2019, though Honeywell estimates 70 or fewer planes with affected screens are still flying. Experts suggest numerous cell phones left on during a flight could still create interference, highlighting a broader concern beyond the specific display system.

title: Are cellphones a flight danger? They are on these Boeing jets
summary: A 2014 FAA bulletin revealed that passenger cellphones and other radio signals could pose a crash threat to certain Boeing 737 and 777 models due to vulnerable cockpit screens. While Honeywell claims no issues from cellphones, the FAA found interference in tests, and pilots have reported instances of critical flight information disappearing. Hundreds of planes may still be flying with these systems, despite efforts to replace the Honeywell-made units.

title: Forward Collision Warning System for Automotive:- Key Players
summary: This article details the Forward Collision Warning System for Automotive market, including key players, market drivers, restraints, and segmentation. The market is projected to reach USD 33.58 billion by 2026, driven by increasing safety concerns and demand for automated vehicles. Key players mentioned include Delphi Technologies, Robert Bosch GmbH, and DENSO CORPORATION.

title: Aircraft Engine Market to See Huge Growth| Textron, Engine Alliance, Rolls-Royce
summary: A new report by HTF Market Intelligence Consulting Pvt. Ltd. highlights significant growth in the Global Aircraft Engine Market. The comprehensive survey covers key industry players like General Electric, Rolls-Royce Holdings, and Textron, offering qualitative and quantitative data, market dynamics, and competitive landscape analysis. The study forecasts market trends until 2025 and segments data by engine type, application, and geography.

title: Garrett Motion Names Anthony Lodato Vice President and General Manager, North America
summary: Garrett Motion Inc. announced the appointment of Anthony Lodato as vice president and general manager for North America, effective June 1, 2019. In this role, Lodato will lead the company's business development, plant operations, and sales efforts in the region, focusing on maximizing market opportunities for automotive software, R&D, and electric products. Lodato brings 20 years of experience with Garrett and Honeywell, having previously served as senior director of Customer Management, North America.

title: Honeywell HQ to anchor latest office tower at Legacy Union in uptown
summary: Honeywell is set to anchor the third office tower at Legacy Union in uptown Charlotte, occupying approximately 280,000 square feet at 700 S. Mint St. The electronics manufacturer is relocating its corporate headquarters to Charlotte from New Jersey.

title: GM CEO Barra avoids driverless-taxi timeline in Cruise update
summary: General Motors Co. CEO Mary Barra did not provide a timeline for GM Cruise LLC's driverless taxi deployment during the company's virtual annual shareholder meeting, emphasizing that safety is the primary gating factor. Despite significant investment in Cruise, including $1 billion planned for 2019, Barra highlighted GM's ongoing restructuring efforts aimed at cutting costs and redirecting capital towards autonomous, electrification, and mobility initiatives. These efforts include plant closures, workforce reductions, and new investments in other U.S. facilities to reposition GM as a strategic and agile company.

title: Aircraft communication system market
summary: The aircraft communication system market is projected to grow from $1.6 billion in 2018 to $2.9 billion by 2025, driven by increased passenger demand for connectivity, commercial aircraft production, and regulatory policies. Key growth segments include SATCOM systems and antennas. Major players in the market include Collins Aerospace, Honeywell Aerospace, and Lockheed Martin.

title: Honeywell to provide high-speed communications system for fleet of C-17 aircraft
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has been selected to provide its high-speed satellite communications system, JetWave, for 70 C-17 Globemaster III transport aircraft of the U.S. Air Force. This system will enhance en route communication capabilities, providing broadband connectivity for real-time situational awareness and command-and-control links. The deployment, part of the Fixed Installation Satellite Antenna program, will see initial deliveries by June 2019 and run through 2021.

title: Honda Conducting Research with American Electric Power to Develop 2nd Life for Used EV Batteries
summary: Honda and American Electric Power (NYSE: AEP) are collaborating on research to develop a second life for used EV batteries. This initiative aims to integrate these batteries into AEP's electricity system, addressing challenges related to EV expansion, grid strain, and sustainable energy storage. The project will utilize used Honda Fit EV batteries to explore vehicle grid integration and new business models, promoting CO2 emission reduction and energy security.

title: Aircraft Sensors Market Cruising Skyward
summary: The aircraft sensors market is projected to grow from $3.8 billion in 2019 to $4.9 billion by 2025, driven by increasing aircraft orders and rising military expenditure. The flight deck & flight controls segment is estimated to hold the largest market share, with UAV and wireless sensor segments experiencing the highest CAGR. North America is identified as the largest market, and key players include Honeywell International, Inc., TE Connectivity Ltd., and General Electric Company.

title: Gilat Sees Slight Revenue Dip, Yet Growth in Profitablity
summary: Gilat Satellite Networks reported a slight dip in Q1 2019 revenues to $62.1 million compared to Q1 2018, however, profitability increased. Adjusted EBITDA rose 9.0 percent year over year to $8.2 million, and GAAP net income increased 22.2 percent to $2.8 million. The company highlighted significant business progress in In-Flight Connectivity and Mobile Cellular Backhaul, including a partnership with Honeywell and a deal with TIM Brasil.

title: Honeywell UOP provides LNG pretreatment technology for Calcasieu Pass
summary: Honeywell UOP will supply its natural gas pretreatment technologies to Venture Global LNG for the Calcasieu Pass LNG export facility in Louisiana. These technologies will remove contaminants like water, mercury, carbon dioxide, and sulfur from natural gas, preparing it for liquefaction and transport. The modular design aims to reduce construction costs and ensure reliable, efficient LNG production.

title: Press Release: Honeywell selects Gilat aero modem for JetWave satcom
summary: Honeywell has selected Gilat Satellite Networks' Taurus IFC modem for its JetWave satellite communication system. This integration will enable Honeywell to offer its JetWave solution in new territories, initially deploying in China's HTS Ka network, and aims to expand global in-flight connectivity. The partnership leverages Gilat's extensive global IFC network and high-performance aero-modem technology.

title: B.H Properties acquires Honeywell campus in Glendale
summary: B.H. Properties of Los Angeles has acquired the Honeywell Aerospace Glendale DSES Campus, a critical facility for aerospace and defense manufacturing in Arizona. The campus, which includes offices, clean rooms, R&D labs, and assembly areas totaling 252,300 square feet, is 100 percent occupied by Honeywell International Inc. and will extend its occupancy until July 2024. This acquisition strengthens B.H. Properties' presence in the West with a mission-critical asset and highlights Glendale's growth as a hub for major corporate campuses.

title: Major Carriers Strive to Automate Loading and Unloading Trucks
summary: Major carriers like FedEx and UPS are investing in automation to streamline the crucial but challenging process of loading and unloading trucks, particularly due to the varied nature of packages. Honeywell and Siemens AG have developed distinct solutions: Honeywell's mobile unit uses suction cups, while Siemens' system requires a permanent rolling belt in the trailer. These innovations aim to improve efficiency and employee satisfaction, though market availability dates are yet to be announced.

title: Robots edging closer to the key task of unloading trucks
summary: FedEx and UPS are investing in robots to automate truck unloading as e-commerce surges and Amazon expands its logistics. Companies like Honeywell and Siemens have developed machines that can unload trucks as fast as humans, mitigating the strenuous nature of the job. While unloading is closer to being solved, companies like Dorabot are also making progress on the more complex task of automating truck loading.

title: Honeywell wins $70.5 million Army contract for tank work
summary: Honeywell has secured a $70.5 million contract from the U.S. Army for work related to the M1 Abrams series of tanks. This program involves upgrading the engines and providing logistics planning, engineering services, and spare parts for the Honeywell-built AGT1500 gas turbine engine. The contract aims to support and enhance the main fighting vehicle of the military.

title: Ball Aerospace Highlights Phased Array Antennas, Optical Communications and Small Mission Solutions for Commercial and Government Applications at SATELLITE 2019
summary: Ball Aerospace showcased its expertise in phased array antennas, optical communications, and small mission solutions for both commercial and government applications at SATELLITE 2019. The company is leveraging its decades of experience with government and civil customers to transform the commercial marketplace, emphasizing accessibility and affordability. Key initiatives include developing electronically steerable phased array antennas, collaborating with Honeywell on optical communication terminals, and providing solutions for the small satellite market.

title: Huge award to Vanni family over cancer-causing bowling balls
summary: A Los Angeles County jury awarded $4.4 million to the family of Donald Vanni, a former Arcata Bowl owner, finding Honeywell International Inc. responsible for his mesothelioma and death. The ruling determined that asbestos-laced bowling balls, supplied by Honeywell in the form of discarded brake lining dust, caused Vanni's illness after he routinely drilled finger holes in them without protection. The jury found Honeywell 40 percent liable for failing to warn of the risks associated with the asbestos-containing products.

title: Settlement Reached with Honeywell International Inc. and International Paper Co. for Cleanup of Contaminated Soils and Sediments at North Carolina Superfund Site
summary: The U.S. EPA and Department of Justice announced a settlement with Honeywell International Inc. and International Paper Co. for the cleanup of contaminated soils and sediments at the LCP-Holtrachem Superfund site in Riegelwood, North Carolina. The companies are held responsible for historical industrial discharges of metals, including mercury, and polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) at the site, which operated as a chemical plant from 1963 to 2000. Under the settlement, Honeywell and International Paper will remediate the site, reimburse the United States for cleanup costs, and receive protection from future lawsuits.

title: Honeywell works with Inmarsat to make black box in the cloud a reality
summary: Honeywell Aerospace is collaborating with Inmarsat to advance its "black box in the cloud" solution, aiming to transition traditional black boxes to real-time connected systems for commercial airlines, cargo transport, and business jets. This initiative builds on Honeywell's Connected Recorder-25, which uses Curtiss-Wright’s Fortress hardware, and leverages Inmarsat's SB-Safety and Global Xpress services for data transmission. While regulatory hurdles remain, the goal is to make real-time flight data streaming a reality, improving maintenance and performance.

title: Executive column: Honeywell Indonesia to focus on aviation, smart building technology
summary: Honeywell Indonesia is shifting its strategic focus from oil and gas to aviation and smart building technology due to a shortfall in Indonesia's energy investments. The company sees significant growth potential in the aviation industry across ASEAN and the property sector in Indonesia and Malaysia, driven by an expanding middle class. Honeywell plans to differentiate itself in these new markets through "connectivity."

title: Here's the next big tech firm looking for a new office in the city
summary: Honeywell is reportedly seeking a new office space of approximately 60,000 square feet in downtown Pittsburgh and the Strip District. This move indicates a potential expansion or relocation for the tech firm within the city. The article highlights recent activities by tech companies in the Pittsburgh area's commercial real estate market.

title: Exclusive: PTC Vet Kerry Grimes Joins Schneider Electric’s Aveva To Lead Global Partner Program
summary: Kerry Grimes, former channel chief at PTC, has joined Aveva Software, which is majority-owned by Schneider Electric, as its new head of global partners. His primary goal is to make Aveva a more "partner-centric company" by unifying three existing partner programs and leveraging the Wonderware partner network to sell other Aveva solutions. Grimes will also focus on strengthening the "go to market" relationship between Aveva and Schneider Electric.

title: Chevron awards Matrix ionic alkylation unit construction
summary: Chevron has awarded Matrix Service Inc. the construction contract for the first ionic alkylation unit in the U.S. at its Salt Lake City refinery. This unit will replace an existing hydrofluoric acid alkylation unit and utilize the ISOALKY™ technology to produce cleaner-burning fuels. Matrix Service Co. expressed pride in being selected for this historic project, highlighting its long-standing relationship with Chevron.

title: Honeywell Launches Online Store to Streamline Access to Business-Critical Software
summary: Honeywell has launched the Honeywell Marketplace, an online store designed to simplify the process of discovering, evaluating, and purchasing business-critical software solutions. This platform caters to a wide range of industries and features software from Honeywell and third-party vendors, streamlining access to essential tools for businesses. The marketplace also offers software vendors a flexible approach to connect with customers and manage transactions.

title: 20 Companies Profiting the Most From War
summary: This article identifies the top 20 companies that profit most from war, based on their arms sales in 2017. It highlights the significant increase in global military spending and the dominance of U.S. companies in the defense industry. The article provides detailed financial data and company profiles for each ranked entity, including their arms sales, total sales, profit, and number of employees.

title: Honeywell-Pratt Venture Protests GE’s Army Helicopter Contract
summary: A joint venture between Honeywell International Inc and Pratt & Whitney has protested the U.S. Army's decision to award General Electric Co a $517 million contract. The contract is for new Black Hawk and Apache helicopter engines. The protest was filed with the U.S. Government Accountability Office (GAO) by the Advanced Turbine Engine Co (ATEC).

title: New Black Boxes Offer Ability to Send Real-Time Data From Plane Crashes
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has introduced a new generation of aircraft black boxes that can transmit real-time accident data via satellite. These advanced devices offer greater data storage capacity, aiming to significantly improve the efficiency and speed of plane crash investigations. The technology addresses challenges seen in past incidents, such as the two-year search for the black boxes of Air France Flight 447.

title: General Electric wins $517 million contract to build engines for Army’s next generation helicopters
summary: General Electric Aviation secured a $517 million contract for the Improved Turbine Engine Program (ITEP), beating the Advanced Turbine Engine Company. This award allows GE to build its T901 engine to replace the T700 in the Army's Black Hawks and Apaches, and potentially outfit next-generation reconnaissance helicopters. The T901 aims to address performance issues in hotter conditions and higher altitudes, offering a 25 percent reduction in fuel consumption and a 20 percent increase in service life.

title: Resideo Unveils A New Degree Of Whole Home Comfort At CES 2019
summary: Resideo announced its new Honeywell Home T-Series Smart Thermostats (T9 and T10 Pro) at CES 2019, featuring innovative wireless smart room sensors. These thermostats aim to provide whole-home comfort by adjusting temperatures where and when needed, optimizing for sleep at night and energy savings when away. The T9 model offers DIY installation, while the T10 Pro is professionally installed and includes humidity and ventilation controls.

title: Martime Propulsion: New Solutions Meet New Emission Demands
summary: This article reviews new and upgraded marine propulsion systems designed to meet tightening emission demands from the U.S. EPA and IMO. It highlights innovations including liquefied hydrogen fuel-gas systems, advanced SCR systems, lithium-ion energy storage, and new common-rail diesel engines from various manufacturers. The advancements focus on reducing fuel consumption, emissions, and noise while enhancing performance and flexibility for diverse marine applications.

title: DR Horton, KB Homes: How Big Production Builders Deploy Smart-Home Technology Today
summary: Major home builders DR Horton and KB Home are integrating smart-home technology into their new constructions, recognizing the evolving expectations of homebuyers, especially Millennials. They emphasize the importance of "white-glove" service to assist customers with setup and understanding of these systems to ensure satisfaction. Both companies are now including base packages of smart devices in all their homes, prioritizing user-friendly platforms that integrate various devices and foregoing voice assistant-only systems due to privacy concerns.

title: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) Gloves Market- Growth
summary: The North America PPE gloves market was valued at $2,406 million in 2017 and is projected to reach $3,750 million by 2025, growing at a CAGR of 5.75%. Key drivers include increased awareness of work safety and the rapid growth of the pharmaceutical and food processing industries. Strategic investments in technological advancements by manufacturers and research institutions are expected to enhance PPE glove performance.

title: LendingTree CEO flips script on North Carolina's recruiting battle with South Carolina
summary: LendingTree Inc. CEO Doug Lebda praised politicians and government administrators for their efforts in making Charlotte an attractive place to keep the publicly traded company. This statement was made at the Charlotte Regional Business Alliance and comes amidst North Carolina's ongoing recruiting battle, particularly with South Carolina, for businesses. The article highlights LendingTree's plans to move its HQ within Meck County and create 436 jobs.

title: Morris County Chamber of Commerce holds event for retiring President Paul Boudreau
summary: Paul Boudreau, President of the Morris County Chamber of Commerce, is retiring after a decade of service during which membership grew by about 50 percent. Honored at a retirement reception, Boudreau was praised for transforming the chamber into a powerful business organization. Meghan Hunscher will take over as president on January 1st.
source: Morris County NJ News | Daily Record
source_domain: Morris County NJ News | Daily Record

title: Cisco commits $1.5 billion to digital workforce training worldwide
summary: Cisco Systems is investing $1.5 billion in digital workforce training worldwide to address the tech industry's talent shortage. This initiative aims to expand its existing digital skills training programs. The commitment comes as part of Cisco's broader strategic changes within the company.

title: Synthetic Polymer Wax Market | Global Market Analysis Report - 2035
summary: The synthetic polymer wax market is projected to grow from USD 1.7 billion in 2025 to USD 2.9 billion by 2035, exhibiting a CAGR of 5.5%. Polyethylene wax is expected to dominate product types, and the lubricating segment will lead applications. This growth is driven by versatile applications across plastics, coatings, adhesives, and lubricants, with increasing demand for high-performance waxes.

title: 15 Minutes With Honeywell’s General Counsel
summary: Anne Madden ’92, General Counsel at Honeywell International Inc., was interviewed by Law360 regarding her professional career, leadership style, and commitment to diversity and inclusion within the legal industry. Honeywell received a 2018 Employer of Choice Award for its efforts in fostering diversity, which include sponsoring fellows and requiring diverse teams from outside counsel and recruiting firms. Madden emphasized the importance of diverse perspectives for providing high-quality internal products to clients.

title: Honeywell CEO divulges why company picked Charlotte for global HQ
summary: Honeywell's CEO Darius Adamczyk explained why Charlotte was chosen for the company's global headquarters after a highly competitive process. The decision followed bipartisan efforts and an incentives bill passage, leading to Honeywell bringing 750 jobs to the city. This move highlights Charlotte's successful recruiting efforts.

title: Honeywell plans to move world HQ out of N.J.
summary: Honeywell International Inc. is moving its world headquarters from Morris Plains, New Jersey, to Charlotte, North Carolina, establishing 750 jobs there within six years. This move comes after New Jersey provided a $40 million tax credit to retain the company and North Carolina expanded tax breaks for high-paying jobs to attract the industrial conglomerate. Approximately 1,000 employees will remain in New Jersey across six Honeywell locations.

title: RFID Tags Market Report 2018: Segmentation by Types (Passive,
summary: This report details a comprehensive market study on RFID tags, including market segmentation by type (Passive, Active, Semi-passive, Others) and end-user (Healthcare, Retail, Automotive, Logistics, Transportation, Others). It provides an analysis of key manufacturers like Impinj, Inc. and HID Global Corporation, and forecasts market performance from 2018 to 2025. The study also covers value chain analysis, competitive scenarios, and regional market breakdowns.

title: Honeywell will move HQ to NC, but keep 800 jobs in Morris Plains
summary: Honeywell International Inc. is moving its headquarters from Morris Plains, New Jersey, to Charlotte, North Carolina, despite a $40 million tax incentive to stay in New Jersey. Approximately 1,000 Honeywell employees will remain in New Jersey, including 800 in Morris Plains. The company plans to gradually add 500 positions in Charlotte over the next five years.
source: Morris County NJ News | Daily Record

title: Press Release: Rockwell buy complete, UTC to separate into three firms
summary: United Technologies Corp. announced the completion of its acquisition of Rockwell Collins and the intention to separate its commercial businesses, Otis and Carrier, into independent entities. This separation will result in three global companies: United Technologies (comprising Collins Aerospace and Pratt & Whitney), Otis Elevator Company, and Carrier. The move is aimed at driving sustained growth, innovation, and maximizing shareholder value, with the separation expected to be completed in 2020.

title: Honeywell Completes Spin-Off Of Resideo Technologies
summary: Honeywell completed the spin-off of Resideo Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: REZI) on October 29, 2018, with Resideo beginning regular-way trading and opening at $28.00. Resideo will specialize in home heating, ventilation, and air conditioning controls, security markets, and global distribution of security and fire protection products, while Honeywell retains its Aerospace, Performance Materials & Technologies, Building Technologies, and Safety and Productivity Solutions businesses. This spin-off followed the earlier separation of Garrett Motion, Inc., and was structured as a tax-free transaction for shareholders.

title: Amazon, home builder partner for Alexa home installations
summary: Amazon has partnered with TRI Pointe Group, a home builder, to integrate Alexa voice technology into smart homes. This collaboration will see Amazon's smart home products installed in new houses and demonstrated in model homes across eight states, aiming to popularize the Internet of Things in residential settings and encourage greater use of Amazon's ecosystem. This marks Amazon's third such arrangement with home builders, following similar initiatives with Lennar and an investment in Plant Prefab.

title: Honeywell, EMCORE Hold Major Share of Fiber Optic Gyroscope Market
summary: A study by Fact.MR reveals that Honeywell International, Inc. and EMCORE Corporation hold over half of the fiber optic gyroscope (FOG) market share, with optimistic growth prospects of 1.6x during 2018-2026, reaching over US$ 1,000 Mn by 2026. These leading companies are employing shrewd strategies like acquisitions and securing large contracts to increase their market presence. North America is expected to dominate the market, driven by significant investments in defense and growth in the aerospace industry, with strong demand for FOGs in aerospace and defense sectors, especially for inertial navigation systems in drones.

title: Honeywell Completes Spinoff of Resideo Technology, Looks to Move Its HQ Out of Golden Valley
summary: Honeywell has completed the spinoff of its Homes and ADI Global Distribution business, creating a new company called Resideo Technology. Resideo will focus on security solutions and is considering moving its headquarters from Golden Valley to Austin, Texas. This move is part of Honeywell's broader portfolio transformation, which involved shedding $7.5 billion of its overall business through two spinoffs.

title: Honeywell wins $1 billion U.S. Air Force contract
summary: Honeywell has secured a $1 billion contract from the U.S. Air Force for logistics support of secondary power systems on seven aircraft types and ground-based auxiliary power systems. This contract will be managed out of Honeywell Aerospace offices in Phoenix and is a continuation of their existing support for the Air Force.

title: Honeywell expanding Midtown software center, adding at least 300 jobs
summary: Honeywell is expanding its software center in Midtown Atlanta, located at 715 Peachtree, and plans to add at least 300 new jobs. The expansion includes a makeover of the building, converting conventional office space into a more modern loft-style configuration, refreshing the lobby and adding new street-level retail and landscaping. Honeywell's current lease of 80,000 square feet will expand to nearly half of the 10-story building.

title: Honeywell adding hundreds of jobs in Atlanta, its new home base for home tech
summary: Honeywell is expanding its home technologies business in Midtown Atlanta, adding hundreds of jobs. This marks a shift for the business, which was previously based in Minnesota. The expansion coincides with a significant makeover of Midtown's 715 Peachtree building, where Honeywell will be located.

title: Honeywell Spinoff Resideo to Begin Trading on NYSE
summary: Honeywell has announced that its spinoff, Resideo Technologies, Inc., will begin trading on the NYSE on October 29, 2018, under the symbol “REZI.” Current Honeywell shareholders will receive one share of Resideo common stock for every six shares of Honeywell common stock. This move marks the final phase of Honeywell's portfolio transformation, aimed at creating a more focused company while positioning Resideo for independent growth in home comfort and security.

title: Honeywell to provide support for Abrams gas turbine engines
summary: The U.S. Department of Defense awarded Honeywell International Inc. a $37 million contract to provide parts for the AGT-1500 tank engine used in Abrams M1 Main Battle Tanks. The work is expected to be completed by October 2020 in Phoenix, Arizona. The AGT1500 gas turbine engine has powered the Abrams tank since the early 1980s, known for its mobility, power, and multi-fuel capabilities.

title: Honeywell to buy German warehouse automation firm Transnorm for $493 million
summary: Honeywell International Inc announced it will acquire Germany-based Transnorm for approximately 425 million euros ($492.8 million) to bolster its presence in the warehouse automation market. Transnorm, which specializes in shipping systems for e-commerce, generates annual sales of about 100 million euros, with a 30 percent growth forecast for the current year. This acquisition follows Honeywell's spin-off of its transportation systems business, Garrett Motion Inc, and its ongoing process to spin off Resideo Technologies Inc.

title: Embarking on a New Journey | Why Garrett?
summary: Garrett Motion officially announced its spin-off from Honeywell on October 1, 2018, marking its debut as an independently traded company. President and CEO Olivier Rabiller highlighted Garrett's commitment to transforming the transportation industry through advanced technology, global presence, and customer-focused approach. The company, with 7,500 employees, 1,400 patents, and $3.1 billion in revenue, aims to continue pioneering innovation in turbocharger development, electric boosting, and automotive software.

title: Safety Light Curtain Market by Top Key Industry Players:
summary: The safety light curtain market is projected to experience substantial growth driven by increased industrial accidents, Industry 4.0 adoption, and stringent government regulations for workplace safety. Key market segments include resolution types (25mm-90mm for hand detection), end-use industries (automotive, healthcare, food & beverages, packaging), and protection levels (Type 4 offering faster response). Despite challenges like high maintenance, the market is poised for growth, particularly in Asia Pacific, with major players like Rockwell Automation and Omron Corporation enhancing product capabilities.

title: Energy Management Systems (EMS): Market 2018 Segmented
summary: This article announces the release of a market research report on Energy Management Systems (EMS) published by QY Research Groups. The report segments the EMS market by manufacturers, type, application, and region, providing an analysis of global market trends and forecasts to 2025. It highlights key players, market drivers, challenges, opportunities, and strategies for investment and business expansion.

title: Honeywell will keep local presence after spinoffs — but how big?
summary: Honeywell is spinning off its home and transportation businesses into new companies. The article discusses the implications of these spinoffs for Honeywell's presence in the Twin Cities, where it currently employs about 3,700 people through its home and aerospace divisions. The exact size of its future local presence remains unclear.

title: Garrett Motion Inc. CONNECTED PLANT HELPS VISUALIZE AND OPTIMIZE ENERGY USE AT TURBOCHARGER PLANT IN JAPAN (FORMER HONEYWELL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS)
summary: Honeywell announced the implementation of its Connected Plant Asset Performance solution at its Kodama turbocharger plant in Japan. This cloud-based technology helps visualize and optimize energy use, leading to reduced consumption and costs by monitoring and analyzing data from nearly 70 field devices. This marks the first deployment of this solution in Asia, demonstrating its capability for data-driven optimization in existing facilities.

title: Asbestos Lung Cancer Lawsuit Claims DAP and Honeywell Products Caused Deadly Illness
summary: A Missouri resident has filed an asbestos lung cancer lawsuit against DAP, Honeywell International Inc., and General Gasket Corp., alleging that their asbestos-containing products caused his lung cancer. The plaintiff, John B., was exposed to asbestos fibers while working in Pennsylvania in the 1970s and was diagnosed with lung cancer in September 2017. He and his wife are seeking over $50,000 in damages, court costs, and attorneys' fees, claiming the companies negligently used asbestos and failed to warn workers of the risks.

title: How a DuPont Spinoff Lobbied the EPA to Stave Off the Use of Environmentally Friendly Coolants
summary: Chemours, a DuPont spinoff, lobbied the Environmental Protection Agency to promote its HFO refrigerants and discourage the use of natural coolants, despite the latter being more environmentally friendly. The company sought to protect its significant investments in HFOs and secure a competitive advantage in the global market, downplaying the environmental and safety benefits of natural alternatives. This article highlights the conflict between corporate interests and environmental protection in the refrigerant industry.

title: Industrial Automation Control Market Is Thriving Worldwide | ABB, Emerson Electric, Honeywell
summary: The Global Industrial Automation Control Market report by HTF MI provides an in-depth overview and market outlook to 2023, identifying key players like ABB, Emerson Electric, Honeywell, Rockwell Automation, Siemens, Toshiba, Mitsubishi & Omron. The study emphasizes the market's growth due to advancements in sensor technology and increasing adoption across process and discrete industries. It segments the market by type (Sensors, DCS, Drives, SCADA & PLC), application (Process Industry & Discrete Industry), organization size, industry, and region, forecasting continued expansion and competitive strategies focused on innovation.

title: Honeywell To License Its Brand To Homes Spin, Reveals Post-Spin Company Name Will Be Resideo
summary: Honeywell announced that Resideo will be the corporate name for its Homes product portfolio and ADI global distribution businesses after they spin off into a stand-alone, publicly traded company by the end of 2018. Honeywell will license its brand to Resideo for use in its home comfort and security hardware and software solutions under a long-term agreement. This new company, Resideo, will benefit from an extensive network of professional partners, a strong product pipeline, and aims to provide integrated, simple solutions for the connected home.

title: Petron To Expand Its Limay Refinery With Technologies from Honeywell
summary: Petron Corporation is expanding and upgrading its Limay, Bataan refinery in the Philippines using technologies from Honeywell UOP. This project will increase the refinery's capacity by 55 percent, allowing it to produce 75,000 barrels per day of refined fuels and 1 million tons per annum of aromatics. The expansion aims to meet the Philippines' growing domestic demand for cleaner-burning motor fuels by upgrading condensates and light crude oils.

title: Airport Security Systems Market Outlook to 2025 - Honeywell
summary: This article provides an outlook on the Airport Security Systems market to 2025, highlighting key players like Honeywell International Inc., Bosch Security Systems, and Thales Group. It discusses the market's growth drivers, challenges, and opportunities, emphasizing the increasing integration of technology for enhanced airport safety. The report aims to offer in-depth analysis and insights for decision-makers in the global market.

title: Fiber Optic Gyroscope Market Size, Global SWOT Analysis
summary: The Fiber Optic Gyroscope Market is projected to reach USD 1,675.87 Million by 2025, growing at a CAGR of 3.3% from USD 1,318.56 Million in 2017. Key drivers include effective integration due to compact design and miniaturization, as well as increasing demand for remotely operated vehicles and industrial applications. Honeywell International Inc. currently dominates the market, followed by KVH Industries, Inc. and EMCORE Corporation.

title: Medical Sensors Market Rising In Wearable and Diagnosis Sector
summary: The global medical sensors market is projected to reach USD 19.07 billion by 2025, growing at a CAGR of 8.3% from 2018 to 2025. This growth is driven by the increasing use of wearable and diagnostic kits, rising awareness among patients, and increased investment in R&D. Key players in this market include Philips NV, Medtronic, and Honeywell International Inc., with major market drivers being improvements in diagnostic tools and increasing prevalence of chronic diseases.

title: Alight Solutions' Jason Lish Takes Unusual Path From Chief Security Officer To CIO
summary: Jason Lish has been promoted to Chief Information Officer of Alight Solutions, a move considered unusual due to his previous role as Chief Security Officer. This transition highlights Alight Solutions' belief in his ability to balance risk-taking with risk management, an essential skill for a CIO with an innovation mandate. Lish's experience advising other technology firms and his background in security at companies like Charles Schwab and Honeywell contributed to his broader perspective.

title: Logistics Movers: Honeywell Names Former SpaceX, Amazon Executive to Run Supply Chain
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has appointed Torsten Pilz, a former senior supply-chain executive at SpaceX and Amazon.com Inc., as its new senior vice president and chief supply chain officer. This move aims to address rising transportation costs and new tariffs. Pilz will be responsible for overseeing procurement and delivery of goods, as well as improving efficiency across the company's plants.

title: Growing Industry of Gas Masks Market | Top Key Company’s - 3M,
summary: A new report titled "Global Gas Masks Market Research Report 2018" by Business Industry Reports indicates a healthy growth rate for the gas masks market from 2018 to 2025. Key factors driving this growth include industrialization in emerging countries and increased government budget allocation for civic safety equipment, particularly benefiting the Powered Air Purifying Respirators segment. The report provides an in-depth analysis of market trends, leading players like 3M, Honeywell, and MSA Safety, and future strategies for investors and suppliers.

title: Honeywell sues Exxon Mobil over Onondaga Lake pollution, cleanup costs
summary: Honeywell has filed a federal lawsuit against Exxon Mobil Corp. and Buckeye Pipeline Co. to recoup some of the estimated $500 million it is spending on the cleanup of Onondaga Lake. Honeywell claims that Exxon Mobil and Buckeye are responsible for petroleum product leaks from the former Oil City area into the lake, contributing to the contamination. The lawsuit seeks an "equitable share" of cleanup costs, arguing that the companies have denied or unreasonably minimized their liability despite years of negotiations.

title: U.S. EPA orders $21 million in cleanup work at San Fernando Valley Superfund site
summary: The U.S. EPA has ordered Lockheed Martin Corporation and Honeywell International, Inc. to undertake over $21 million in expanded groundwater treatment and contamination studies at the San Fernando Valley Area 1 Superfund site. These actions aim to ensure safe groundwater supplies and address contaminants from former aerospace manufacturing facilities. The cleanup involves constructing new extraction wells, expanding treatment plant capacity, and conducting a feasibility study to assess current contamination levels.

title: Honeywell to rebrand turbo unit upon completion of spinoff
summary: Honeywell plans to rebrand its turbo unit upon the completion of its spinoff. The article, published in Automotive News Suppliers, focuses on this corporate decision.

title: Honeywell testing technology that may replace pilots
summary: Honeywell is testing advanced aviation technology, including systems that could lead to pilotless passenger planes in the future. These tests, conducted in Arizona, involve new 3-D weather radar, improved WiFi, and more efficient turbofan jets, aimed at reducing pilot workload and enhancing safety. While the technology is developing, concerns remain about public acceptance and regulatory hurdles for autonomous flights, particularly in commercial aviation.

title: Boeing goes vertical and partners with Safran on auxiliary power units for planes
summary: Boeing and Safran have formed a 50-50 joint venture to design, build, and service auxiliary power units (APUs) for aircraft. This partnership is part of Boeing's strategy to expand its services portfolio and increase its vertical capabilities, aiming for $50 billion annually from aviation services. The move is expected to intensify competition with current major APU suppliers like Honeywell and United Technologies' Pratt & Whitney.

title: Boeing takes on Honeywell, UTX with new joint venture
summary: Boeing is challenging aerospace giants Honeywell and United Technologies by forming a new joint venture with French engine manufacturer Safran. This partnership aims to produce and service auxiliary power units (APUs) for commercial airplanes, a market currently dominated by Honeywell and United Technologies. The move is part of Boeing's strategy to expand its global services business as a major growth opportunity.

title: Longtime Honeywell pilot makes latest test flight his last
summary: Captain Helmuth Eggeling III, a pilot with 53 years of experience, made his final test flight for Honeywell. He was greeted by family, friends, and co-workers upon his return to Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport.

title: Honeywell Enters Partnership With Israeli Defense Contractor IAI
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has partnered with Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI) to develop a turnkey GPS anti-jam navigation system. This collaboration integrates IAI's ADA anti-radio frequency system with Honeywell's GPS navigation products. IAI anticipates this partnership will help them reach new clients and significantly increase revenues from the ADA system.

title: Zebra (Xplore Technologies) M60
summary: Xplore Technologies, known as the "Rugged Tablet Authority," has launched its first rugged handheld computer, the M60, in response to the growing demand for powerful yet ultra-mobile devices. Running on Android 8.0 "Oreo" with a 6-inch screen, the M60 distinguishes itself from consumer smartphones through its inherent ruggedness, industrial-grade scanner, extensive accessories, and enterprise-focused software features like Android for Work and MDM/EMM certification. Its robust specifications, including a long-lasting replaceable battery and high IP68 sealing, make it suitable for demanding professional environments where consumer devices fall short.

title: Ball Aerospace to Collaborate with Honeywell for Optical Com
summary: Ball Aerospace and Honeywell are collaborating to develop and produce high-performance Optical Communication DataLinks for satellite operators. This partnership aims to establish volume production of optical terminals for high-speed communications across various platforms, leveraging their combined 60 years of experience in optical communications and North American sourced parts. The initiative will provide a secure, high-capacity, and affordable solution for commercial and U.S. government markets, complementing traditional radio frequency systems with advanced laser technology.

title: Industrial Control Systems Security Market Growth and Trends
summary: The Industrial Control Systems (ICS) Security Market is experiencing significant growth due to increasing cyber-attacks on critical infrastructure and the adoption of Industry 4.0. The market was valued at over USD 1.5 billion in 2017 and is projected to exceed USD 7 billion by 2024, growing at a CAGR of 20% from 2018 to 2024. North America held a 50% market share in 2017, driven by robust industry standards and government initiatives to enhance ICS security.

title: Thermafiber SAFB FF by Owens Corning
summary: The article describes Thermafiber SAFB FF by Owens Corning, a formaldehyde-free mineral wool batt insulation designed for fire protection and sound abatement in various interior assemblies. It highlights the product's available thicknesses, widths, NRC rating, and its non-combustible, moisture-, and mold-resistant properties. The insulation is suitable for walls, floors, and ceilings.

title: Iridium messaging network gets another boost from SpaceX
summary: SpaceX launched 10 more Iridium Next satellites aboard a Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg Air Force Base, increasing the total upgraded Iridium spacecraft to 50. This mission was part of Iridium's $3 billion upgrade investment for its communication network, which recently surpassed one million subscribers. SpaceX also attempted to recover part of the Falcon 9's payload fairing, though the attempt was unsuccessful due to a twisted parafoil.

title: Honeywell signs deals with Saudi Aramco, Advanced Electronics
summary: Honeywell International Inc. has signed cooperative agreements with Saudi Aramco and Advanced Electronics Co. (AEC) during the Saudi-US CEO Forum. These deals aim to accelerate industrial growth and economic diversification in Saudi Arabia by providing advanced industrial automation systems and enhancing existing cooperation in aerospace and defense sectors.

title: Penske Truck Leasing Adds Digital Prompts for Maintenance Technicians
authors: John Sommers II for Transport Topics
summary: Penske Truck Leasing has implemented a new digital and voice-directed preventive maintenance system for its fleet of over 266,000 vehicles. This system, based on customized Honeywell technology, uses voice prompts to guide technicians through inspections, tailoring the process to each vehicle's specifics. The company expects this will lead to fewer errors, higher job satisfaction, and increased productivity among its maintenance staff.

title: Honeywell to acquire Swiss-based energy controls firm for $130M
summary: Honeywell International Inc. is set to acquire Saia Burgess Controls for $130 million. The Swiss-based company, which manufactures programmable heating and cooling controls for commercial buildings, will integrate into Honeywell’s Environmental and Combustion Controls business. The acquisition is expected to be finalized in January.

title: Honeywell CEO earns 333 times more than average worker at the company
summary: A recently implemented SEC rule revealed that the CEO of Honeywell earns 333 times more than the average worker at the company. This disclosure from Honeywell International Inc. shows one of the first reported CEO-to-rank-and-file worker pay gaps from a major U.S. company. In fiscal 2017, the median employee compensation at Honeywell was $50,296.

title: Mining and steel company opens facility in Detroit
summary: ArcelorMittal Tailored Blanks has opened an $83 million facility in Detroit's I-94 Industrial Park, bringing 80 new jobs to the city. The Luxembourg-based company, which builds and supplies laser-welded blanks for automakers, received a 10-year property tax abatement and a $2 million performance-based grant from Michigan. This opening marks a significant step in the area's revival, with plans to expand to 120 jobs by 2023.

title: Materion Corp. names Marc Rands as vice president of global operations
summary: Materion Corp. (NYSE: MTRN) has appointed Marc Rands as its new vice president of global operations, a newly created role reporting directly to the CEO. Rands joins Materion from Honeywell International Inc. and will be responsible for developing a "One Materion Operations function" to drive operating efficiencies and best practices globally. He brings extensive experience in manufacturing, logistics, quality, and continuous improvement to the advanced materials supplier.

title: Building Management System (BMS) Market Growth by Top Key
summary: This article provides an analysis of the global Building Management System (BMS) market, forecasting its growth from 2017 to 2024. Key market drivers include increased demand for energy-efficient systems and growing automation in security, with the market expected to reach USD 54.0 billion by 2016. The report segments the market by software, services, and application, and identifies major competitors and geographical trends.
